WizardTD.Button

Class Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • WizardTD.Button.Button
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameSpeedButton, ManaButton, TowerButton, UpgradeButton

    public abstract class Button
extends java.lang.Object
    The Button class stores data about a clickable button in the game. It provides a graphical user interface element that can be clicked by the player. This class is intended to be extended for specific button types.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean getIsClicked()
      Checks if the button is currently clicked.
      java.lang.String getLabel()
      Returns the label or text associated with the button.

      Returns the short-hand identifier of the button.
      float getX()
      Returns the x-coordinate of the button.
      float getY()
      Returns the y-coordinate of the button.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Button

        public Button(float x,
              float y,
              java.lang.String shortHand,
              java.lang.String label,
              boolean isClicked)
        Creates a new Button instance with the specified coordinates, shortHand, label, and initial click state.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the button.
        y - The y-coordinate of the button.
        shortHand - The short-hand identifier for the button.
        label - The label or text associated with the button.
        isClicked - The initial click state of the button.

    • Method Detail

        Returns the x-coordinate of the button.

        Returns the short-hand identifier of the button.

      • getLabel

        public java.lang.String getLabel()
        Returns the label or text associated with the button.
        Returns:
        The label or text of the button.

      • getIsClicked

        public boolean getIsClicked()
        Checks if the button is currently clicked.
        Returns:
        true if the button is clicked; otherwise, false.

      • isClicked

        public void isClicked()
        Toggles the click state of the button. If the button is not clicked, it will be set to clicked, and vice versa.
